rel="noopener"><span class="icon icon-pinterest"></span></a></div><img style="height: 315px; width: 644px; background: #000"></div><figcaption>Tim Cook speaking at the commencement speech for Tulane University (YouTube)</figcaption></figure><p>Apple boss Tim Cook told university graduates in New Orleans that ‘my generation has failed you’.</p><p>The 58-year-old American tech boss told the graduates of Tulane University that in the area of climate change, not enough had been done.</p><p>He cited New Orleans’ own recovery from Hurricane Katrina as one example of coastal communities bearing the human cost of our changing climate.</p><p>‘In some important ways, my generation has failed you,’ he said. ‘We have spent too much time debating, we have been focused on the fight and not focused enough on progress.’</p><p>‘Here, today, in this very place where thousands once found desperate shelter from a hundred-year disaster, I don’t think we can talk about who we are as people and what we owe to one another without talking about climate change.’</p><figure class="alignnone img-container shareable-item" style="max-width:540px"><div class="img-wrap"><a id="share-item-0-256" class="anchor"></a><div class="item-share-buttons item-share" style=""><a class="share-item share-item-facebook btn" title="Share this on Facebook" data-track="share-item-facebook"><span class="icon icon-facebook"></span></a><a class="share-item share-item-twitter btn" target="_blank" title="Share this on Twitter" data-track="share-item-twitter" rel="noopener"><span class="icon icon-twitter"></span></a><a class="share-item share-item-pinterest btn" target="_blank" title="Share this on Pinterest" data-track="share-item-pinterest" rel="noopener"><span class="icon icon-pinterest"></span></a></div><img style="height: 540px; width: 540px; background: #000"></div><figcaption>Floodwaters from Hurricane Katrina surround homes in New Orleans. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip, File)</figcaption></figure><p>Cook, who succeeded Apple’s legendary co-founder Steve Jobs as CEO in 2011, also spoke about the divisiveness of current politics when it comes to helping the climate.</p><div class="ad-slot-container" style=""><div class="ad-slot ad-slot-small ad-slot-in-content" id="mpu_mobile_top" data-adverts-tags="[]" style=""><span class="ad-slot-label-container"><span class="ad-slot-label">Advertisement</span></span></div></div><p>‘When we talk about climate change or any issue with [a] human cost, I challenge you to look for those who have the most to lose and find the real empathy that comes from something shared.’</p><p>‘When you do that, the political noise dies down and you can feel your feet firmly planted on solid ground. After all, we don’t build monuments to trolls.’</p><iframe style="height: 207px; width: 500px; background: #000"></iframe><p></p><figure class="alignnone img-container shareable-item" style="max-width:540px"><div class="img-wrap"><a id="share-item-0-820" class="anchor"></a><div class="item-share-buttons item-share" style=""><a class="share-item share-item-facebook btn" title="Share this on Facebook" data-track="share-item-facebook"><span class="icon icon-facebook"></span></a><a class="share-item share-item-twitter btn" target="_blank" title="Share this on Twitter" data-track="share-item-twitter" rel="noopener"><span class="icon icon-twitter"></span></a><a class="share-item share-item-pinterest btn" target="_blank" title="Share this on Pinterest" data-track="share-item-pinterest" rel="noopener"><span class="icon icon-pinterest"></span></a></div><img style="height: 540px; width: 540px; background: #000"></div><figcaption>Tim Cook speaking at Apple’s Worldwide Developer conference in San Jose, California, last year U.S. (Reuters)</figcaption></figure><p>He also urged the students to be bold in their decision making.</p><p>‘Whatever you do, don’t make the mistake of being too cautious.</p><p>‘Don’t assume that by staying put, the ground won’t move beneath your feet. The status quo simply won’t last. So get to work on building something better. You may succeed. You may fail. But make it your life’s work to remake the world. Because there is nothing more beautiful or worthwhile than working to leave something better for humanity.’</p>										<div data-bttnio-id="btn-3636678a3fce1956" class="widget"></div>										<!--
